conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves.
The shadow is cast by the object and is influenced by the position and intensity of the light source.
Object D: An ice cream sundae
The shadows are labeled as A, B, C, and D.
Shadow A is cast by the lampshade.
Shadow B is cast by the baseball glove.
Shadow C is cast by the cake.
Shadow D is cast by the ice cream sundae.
Understand the effect of moving the light source forward.

premise: When the light source moves forward, it will be closer to the objects.
conclusion: This will affect the angle at which the light hits the objects and the ground.

premise: As the light source gets closer, the shadows will generally get larger.
conclusion: The angle of incidence will change, and the projection of the objects on the ground will be more elongated.

premise: Shadow A (Lampshade): The shadow will become larger and possibly more elongated as the light source gets closer and the angle of incidence changes.
conclusion: Shadow A will become larger and more elongated.

premise: Shadow B (Baseball Glove): The shadow will also become larger and more elongated for the same reason.
conclusion: Shadow B will become larger and more elongated.

premise: Shadow C (Cake): The shadow will become larger and more elongated.
conclusion: Shadow C will become larger and more elongated.

premise: Shadow D (Ice Cream Sundae): The shadow will become larger and more elongated.
conclusion: Shadow D will become larger and more elongated.
